notes.title: Follow Up with Mr. Ashton
notes.content: Following up on our meeting with Mr. Ashton, I wanted to recap the key points discussed and outline the action items moving forward. During the meeting, we touched upon the project timeline, budget considerations, and specific deliverables. Mr. Ashton expressed particular interest in our innovative solutions and requested a detailed proposal by next week. He emphasized the importance of maintaining regular communication and setting up bi-weekly progress reviews.

notes.title: Setlist for Hackathon
notes.content:
- Project Timeline
- Budget Considerations
- Specific Deliverables
- Additional Features for Software Solution
- Detailed Proposal for Review
- Prepare the PPT
- Review by Ravi
- GD
- The Grand Finale

notes.title: Auroras and Sad Prose
notes.content:
In the twilight of northern skies,
Auroras dance with gentle grace.
While down below, a heart still cries,
Longing words leave empty space.

Colors swirl in cosmic streams,
Nature's poetry in the night.
Reality blends into dreams,
As sadness turns to pure delight.

notes.title: Recipe: Classic Tiramisu
notes.content:
Ingredients:
- 6 egg yolks
- 1 cup sugar
- 1¼ cup mascarpone cheese
- 1¾ cup heavy whipping cream
- 2 packages ladyfingers
- 1 cup cold espresso
- ½ cup coffee liqueur
- 1 tbsp cocoa powder

Instructions:
1. Mix yolks & sugar
2. Add mascarpone & whipped cream
3. Dip ladyfingers in coffee mixture
4. Layer & refrigerate overnight
5. Dust with cocoa before serving

notes.title: Book Notes: The Psychology of Money
notes.content:
Key Takeaways:

1. Wealth is hidden - it's the money not spent
2. Compounding is about time, not returns
3. Room for error is more important than returns
4. Luck and risk are siblings
5. Save money to gain control over time

Quote: "Building wealth has little to do with your income or investment returns, and lots to do with your savings rate."

notes.title: Garden Planning 2024
notes.content:
Spring Planting Schedule:

March:
- Start tomatoes indoors
- Plant peas and spinach

April:
- Plant potatoes
- Start herbs

May:
- Transfer tomatoes outside
- Plant cucumbers and zucchini

Remember to:
- Check soil pH
- Set up irrigation system
- Order organic fertilizer
